intro: Pauletia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited pauletia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Pauletia brachycarpa is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats at high altitudes.
